(We also walked to the Royal Palace/ Plaza Mayor/ Puerta del Sol/ El Rastro/ Parque del Retiro, but less adventurous travelers could catch a quick cab or metro to the more distant sites.) Once inside, the hotel's decor was very modern and hip, with super cozy beds and funky images from Madrid on the walls. (We don't usually stay at chain hotels in Europe, but the larger-than-life images of Madrid on the walls made the hotel seem more like a botique hotel and less like a chain.) Our room had a small balcony. The bathroom was top notch, with a fantastic shower. The room had a well-stocked mini bar, but the snack and drink prices were quite steep. The staff was incredibly friendly. We will definitely stay at the Radisson Blu again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice quiet modern new hotel, good location.”
Reviews.Author: Bear V
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel for 4 nights in july 2011. "Normal" sized modern double room with extra bed. The room was quiet, no noise from street or other rooms. Beds ok. Nice breakfast. Very fancy design in room and hotel. Lightning in room terrible. The lightning made the room very hot, and the air condition was not able too keep the room cool. Lightning in the bathroom not useful for make up/shaving. Free wifi internet. No parking, and no help with parking at the hotel. Fitness room in same area as spa, made it to hot for any fitness. Helpful and friendly staff. Good location, very close to museums, restaurants, bars, cafe etc At check out I was presented with an extra charge for for the extra bed. No information on that when I booked the room !!

Reviews.Title: “Your 2nd home in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: Hornelson
Reviews.Content: Defintely my best choice in Madrid. It's located in a wonderful place, just in the pedestrian area with lot of restaurants for dinner. Everything is ten minutes walking, from Prado Musem to Atocha Station if you need to take the AVE train. All the major attractions too are just 10-20 minutes walking. Service is great, staff is warm and they always trying their best to accomplish your requests. Breakfast is very good quality. Defintely my 2nd home in Madrid. And. Mr. Luis, a young front desk staff, is a great professional.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel. A great location.”
Reviews.Author: theCCCCS-Afamily
Reviews.Content: The Radisson Blu has an amazing location centered in the art triangle of Madrid. The location is not the only good thing though, the rooms are amazing too. We had two rooms and one was the suite. It was amazing. It had a great bathroom in the bedroom made of glass. When all of the lights were off the glass appears to be a mirror. The giant bed is as soft as the robes and slippers. The pool is also fantastic. It is small but warm and has jets. It is almost like a giant hot tub. This is one of my favourite contemporary hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Well placed and clean”
Reviews.Author: ellen1979il
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with this hotel - the location can't be beat, the room was very clean and bed very comfortable. The room was a bit on the small side (we were in a handicap accessible room) and although we didn't travel with a wheel chair, it would have been quite tight for someone confined to one. The staff were very helpful and spoke English very well. Breakfast was included in the room rate and was quite adequate. We had several dinners at the hotel (they grant a 50% discount to hotel guests) - food was good and price ok after the discount. Would recommend this hotel, but would warn regarding the small room and lack of a real lobby, otherwise this hotel deserves a "10"!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, very good rooms”
Reviews.Author: smb2011
Reviews.Content: Had a very comfortable stay here. The bathroom is superb!! The room is also very modern and very well designed. Room service was excellent. Breakfast was substantial. Service was very good. Good location as well. Walking distance from museums and the square where the tourism office is.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, friendly staff, modern rooms”
Reviews.Author: DaveMaharaj
Reviews.Content: located 20 minutes from Barajas airport - a 25 Euro cab ride. 15 minute walk to Atocha train station and 20 minutes from Plaza Mayor and Sol. All 3 major museums were within a 5 minute walk. Staff spoke English well and were very kind a courteous to the point of walking us a block to show us our way. Rooms were modern, clean and sized as expected - not too big not too small. We stayed here on 2 separate occasions on this trip - both times we arrived well before posted check-in times and both times were able to be checked into our room without hassle. I recommend this hotel to anyone who is in Madrid for the museums and of those taking the train to other Spanish destinations.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but no hot water”
Reviews.Author: felicityineurope
Reviews.Content: I'm not too sure how to rate this hotel; it was actually ideal for what I needed but there was no hot water and a cold shower in the middle of winter in Madrid doesn't make for a happy stay. I called reception around 7am to ask if there was a problem with the water because my shower wasn't getting hot. The receptionist said no, there wasn't a problem, and offered to send someone to check it out - of course I accepted and she said, OK they'll be there after 9 beause that's when maintenance start work. I had meetings so had to deal with the cold shower, as did my colleague. Upon checkout the receptionist admitted that there was a hotel-wide problem with the hot water but didn't offer any compensation. Overall, I liked this hotel, it's modern, bathroom was spacious and well laid out, bed comfortable, breakfast good, location great so I suppose I would recommend it, maybe check that they plan to have hot water or maintenance staff on hand.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, friendly and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Travelfan2009
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located within easy walking distance of The Prado,Thyssen, Seina Sofia and Caixa Forum Museums - all major attractions and well worthwhile visiting. The Atocha station is a couple of blocks away - with high speed trains to Valencia and Toledo. The hotel itself is small, modern and efficient. The restaurant is great for breakfast - we also had dinner there a couple of times and it was very good quality and value. The reception staff were very helpful in locating a pharmacy nearby and even offered to accompany me to translate ! They also helped with train times and restaurant reservations. I would definitely recommend this hotel to friends and will return here on any future trips to Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: tyny77
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 5 nights. If you are looking for a clean, reasonably priced hotel in a great neighborhood, this is for you. The location could not be better, located in walking distance to the Prado, Reina Sophia, Thyssen-Bornemisza, and the Parque del Buen Retiro. Additionally it is close to the Atocha train station and the metro so traveling around Madrid and Spain is very convenient. The room was very clean with adequate closet space. The bathroom was very trendy. The rain shower was a treat after a long day of walking and it was nice to have a powerful hair dryer provided. The only negatives were that the air conditioning did not work so well and the beds were extremely hard. If you are looking for a full service concierge you will not find one here but the staff is helpful and courteous.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel with Terrible Shower”
Reviews.Author: romcat1106
Reviews.Content: Overall we enjoyed staying at the Radisson but I wouldn't recommend it due to the shower situation. You couldn't take a relaxing shower at all since the water would constantly go from normal temperature to freezing to super hot. Which after a day of sightseeing and walking around for 8 hours it would have been nice just to take a normal shower. ---Pros--- -Bed & Pillows -Decor -TV -Room service options -Friendly service (Pablo was very nice) -Plenty of clothing storage -Nice mini fridge / coffee -Room wifi ---Cons--- -Shower water temperature would get cold to hot constantly. Would never remain the same temperature. -The shower - a bit too modern - wasn't so functional -The sink area wasn't very functional for putting your toiletries around or below -The Hair Dryer if you moved really at all it would come out of the plug

Reviews.Title: “Book a business room - worth the extra”
Reviews.Author: kewfriend
Reviews.Content: Given that this hotel is almost next door to the Syrian Embassy which had recently been daubed in 'blood' red paint, this hotel could not have been in a 'safer' district with all the police lazily observing the comings and goings. Outside are two perfectly good street cafes which we also used. The rooms are exactly as pictured by the hotel: plush, restrained, scrupulously clean. The breakfast was superb and unending. Everything worked. With our room overlooking the small outside square we might have expected noise - it was blissfully quiet. Enormous fluffy pillows decked a bed to sink into. The spa area, though small, was delightful and a wonderful retreat from the heat of the day. We didnt try their own vaunted restaurant - another time. The menu didnt seem that 'adventurous'. Generally Radisson hotels are 'boring'. This one is 'small and perfectly formed'. The location just a few hundred metres from the Prado and Thyssen is excellent. The metro is a short walk away. A further walk brings one to some decent restaurants - nothing very local.

Reviews.Title: “A real pleasure”
Reviews.Author: Pearl2014
Reviews.Content: Very conveniently located - in the centre of town, opposite the Prado museum, a couple of minutes on foot from numerous other good museums/art galleries, in a pleasant, leafy area and within walking distance of many places of interest. The welcome was friendly, staff helpful and the room superb (contemporary design). We booked a suite to accommodate us and our 13 year old - a luxurious bedroom (King size bed) with a comfortable extra bed in the separate living room, an excellent bathroom and a second separate toilet and basin. Very comfortable bed, good sound proofing from the road outside, everything spotlessly clean. Pleasant small spa pool and gym in basement. Not cheap but worth the money. We had a very good dinner in the reasonably priced hotel restaurant and also tried the restaurant directly opposite the hotel (also very good). Would definitely visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Great option in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: 351pete
Reviews.Content: The Radisson Blu Madrid is very nicely located near the Prado and Reina Sofia museums, and also at walking distance from the Atocha train/metro station. The rooms were very comfortable, and unlike other reviews, I didn’t found any issue with the shower. There was also free wi-fi, although with the recent change from goldpoints to club Carlson, it may not be the case anymore.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed bag--location, location, great bed, weird bathroom”
Reviews.Author: NewYorkNYTraveler
Reviews.Content: The location was fabulous-- quiet, across from the Prado. A very attractive neighborhood, not like other areas we walked in in Madrid. The hotel itself is a little weird-- very modern, but the designer missed the boat a lot. The shower, as others note, sprays everywhere because there's not a big enough lip between the shower and the rest of the bathroom. And there was no shower door. It takes an electrical engineer to figure out how to turn the lights and the a/c on and off. And the door to the bathroom opens in the wrong direction. The TV is too big for the room. The bed, however, was unbelievably comfortable and the room was very quiet. The staff was very nice. So, if you just make sure you don't use the hairdryer while your feet are in the puddle on the bathroom floor you'll be fine if you stay here. Oh, we were for some reason put in a handicapped accessible room-- I cannot imagine how someone in a wheelchair could get past the table that was wedged against the door to the bathroom that opened the wrong way that was next to the huge TV set to get into the bathroom. The little cafe right in front of the hotel is great for breakfast-- very inexpensive and good food,

Reviews.Title: “Decent location, average room, nice staff”
Reviews.Author: Katherine L
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a decent location but the room wasn't impressive or great at all. Two single beds pushed together to form the queen bed and the comforter covers for some reason were not long enough to actually cover the entire comforter. The room itself was okay, the bathroom decent, small but clean. The room we had only had a shower, no tub. Room was quiet. We did have to call down to the desk to set the tempertature lower (seemed to occur across several different hotels in Spain..you're only able to control the volume / fan speed in the room). The designers were going for ultra modern/trendy. The staff was friendly and helpful. My husband and I changed hotels (we booked for 4 nights, ended up only staying 2 - luckily with AAA rate so there was no penalty). We ended up not getting / paying for their breakfast and instead went to a local VIPS for a fraction of the price and funny enough probably the only place outside of any hotel which actually was open for eggs/toast type of American breakfast. The metro has 2-3 stops within 5 min walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, clean, and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: whyran7
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel after reading the New York Times review: http://travel.nytimes.com/2010/09/05/travel/05checkin.html and they didn't steer us wrong! It was new, spotlessly clean, and extremely comfortable. The location is, of course, perfect for the museums. It was a bit of a walk to the old quarter (maybe 10-15 minutes), but quite doable. We paid €157 per night for a weekend in early December which is not super cheap, but okay.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable and affable choice with great location”
Reviews.Author: GBR007
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Radisson Blu for one night (Sunday) en route to a workshop I was giving in the north of Madrid on the Monday morning. It turned out to be an excellent choice/ Newly refurbished, the RB offers * A really good buffet breakfast and good coffee * Very modern and comfortable rooms (mine was a standard single) - superb bathroom * Free wifi in rooms and the famous netpresso machines! * Warm (very warm!) gym with a plunge pool - small but fine for those wanting a quick work out *Friendly and efficient front of house - no fuss and quick check in Key bonus is the location - slap opposite the Prado and within easy walking distance of other museums. Plenty of good restaurants just 5-10 minutes walk away heading up the hill towards SOL. All in all - a hotel that met my needs at an affordable price and I would certainly stay there again for future trips to Madrid

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: zzzizzzi
Reviews.Content: This hotel is ideally sitauted for the Prado & Thyssen galleries and is also within easy walking distance of Sol etc. We also thought the breakfast was second to none. Free WiFi is always a bonus and would definately consider this hotel for another visit. The Spa and leisure facilities on the website look better than what they are; three pieces of gym kit and a glorified paddling pool is not my idea of a Spa, however this is not enough to put us off going back.

Reviews.Title: “Quality in city centre”
Reviews.Author: Bingtravel
Reviews.Content: Good and new hotel directly across Prado Hotel in city centre Small room not on a busy road. good beds Service good be beter. Room Locker didn't work and wasn't repaired in three days stay.

Reviews.Title: “Superb staff, lovely hotel and highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: goodadvice12
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Radisson Blu for four nights. The hotel was modern, extremely clean, and in a great location. The staff were wonderful and the quality of the breakfast was excellent. The room was small but adequate and the wifi free and easy to access. The bedroom was initially very hot, but after a word with reception, the temperature was lowered and all was well. Our room did not have an external window, which was the only downside. Overall I would highly recommend and would happily return. The spa is nice but it is not a swimming pool, as some booking agencies suggest.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: JumboJas
Reviews.Content: As far as European hotels go, this is indeed a fairly decent hotel. Although there could be some imrpovement, it is a nice little hotel all in all. Pros - Good location. 3-minute walk from Prado and 10-minute walk from Retiro Park and Atocha (Train station to Toledo). - Pleasant neighbourhood with plenty of bars, cafes and restaurants. We did not exactly brush up our Spanish beforehand but everyone seemed very friendly and keen to recommend different authentic dishes despite the language barrier. It felt very safe to go out even late at night. - Decent room and cool design. Love the huge mirror and over-head shower in the bathroom. - Attentive staff. Cons (rather minor stuff) - I have to agree with previous comments that the water temperature seemed to jump up and down a fair bit. (It was almost like 15-second of decent temperature and 2-second extreme hot.) - Lack of make-up mirror in the bathroom. - Average quality of toiletry: lack of cotton buds and cotton pads. Hair conditioner was very weak. (Having said all that, I could live with it for 4 days.) - Light switches were very random, we had so much trouble working out what switch was for what light.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't ask for better location.”
Reviews.Author: jaym01
Reviews.Content: The standout for the hotel is its location - right across from the Prado, surrounded by great little cafes, 500m from the metro, but on a quiet side street so there's no noise. That was perfect. And overall, it was a wonderful experience. The rooms were lovely, comfy bed, free wifi (thank you!), friendly staff, and I'd have no hesitation in recommending it to anyone on this basis. There were just a few little things that niggled me. 1. The shampoo was terrible. I don't mean just ordinary. I mean I don't even think it was shampoo. My hair was destroyed afterwards. I've never had such an experience. 2. There was only BBC TV in English - unless you wanted to pay 15EU for more English language TV. 3. The strange bathroom design meant it was really impossible to have a shower without getting the whole room wet (although I note the showers were wheelchair friendly, perhaps these things are related). 4. The shower ran hot and cold meaning you had to keep stepping out of it to avoid being burned. All little things - but it's the little things that make the difference, sometimes. And which might make me look around next time. Overall, though, it was brilliant and I probably would stay again. I'd just bring my own shampoo.

Reviews.Title: “Superior staff, but too many other problems”
Reviews.Author: Mousewife
Reviews.Content: The Radisson Blu Madrid has several distinct pluses and minuses. The positives: 1. The hotel staff was unfailingly pleasant, attentive, helpful, professional, and in command of at least adequate English. 2. The location is perfect for the art-tourist: a short walk from the Prado, the Reina Sofia, the Thyssen, and the Royal Academy of Fine Arts. It is also a short walk to the main train station and convenient to a host of restaurants. It is in the middle of everything, yet secluded and quiet. 3. It offers an effectively all-you-can-eat breakfast, a great convenience, and it is substantial: you can select from a better-than-average buffet and/or from the menu. The two in combination offer just about anything you could want. 4. The massage my wife received in the spa was very good. Although the massage therapist did not have much English, we were able to specify areas that needed special attention (feet and back after long hours in museums and sight-seeing) when we booked the appointment. Unfortunately, these were substantially offset by the negatives on my recent visit: 1. The “free wireless” did not work. (In fairness, we did not follow up with the hotel.) 2. The climate control in the room kept it suffocatingly hot. The thermostat did not respond to our efforts, suggesting it was either preset or broken. We spoke to the front desk and asked the preset thermostat to be lowered to 18 C; this was presumably done, but the room remained hot. We endured our five-day stay by keeping the window open. (In fairness, we only inquired once.) 3. The water temperature always felt as if you were on the verge of running out of hot water. It is perhaps appropriate that the water from the sink should never be scalding, but the shower never felt quite warm enough. 4. The channel selection on the television was the most limited I have yet experienced in a European hotel. The only English-language channels available were the BBC and Al Jazeera. 5. The pillows were remarkably limp and flat. 6. I want to be clear that the hotel staff was excellent, but I believe management has left the staff overworked and stretched thin. There was considerable evidence of short-staffing, and I suspect employees maintained their chipper, upbeat mood only because, with Spain’s unemployment rate around 20%, they are too frightened to do otherwise. This possibility was reinforced by a somewhat sinister customer satisfaction survey I received by email after check-out, asking me to name specific hotel employees for credit or blame. In light of all these experiences, I would not recommend the Radisson Blu, particularly as there are several other hotels in the same price range located close by.

Reviews.Title: “Cool hotel in the narrow atmospheric streets of prado”
Reviews.Author: Waldea
Reviews.Content: A cool hotel right in prado. Rooms have huge prints of Madrid streets on the Walls. A bit dark... Trying to be a bit too hip. But still a bit different.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: KarenBirminghamUK
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfect for a city break. Me and my partner are used to staying in modern, super cool hotels and this hotel did not disappoint. Although seeing reviews about the size of the room, we were not disappointed. It was not huge but was perfectly comfortable for the both of us and the bathroom was lovely! The staff at the hotel were very attentive and a young girl at the check in desk gave us some fabulous restaurant recommendations. If you are looking for a very nice meal in a uber cool place....check out Rameses and midnight Rose......both awesome. Our room was cleaned brilliantly every day. Location is perfect.....right opposite Museo Prado and close to everywhere! Word of advice for party animals-do not go to Pasha if you are 25 or over.....full of teenagers! Would definitley recommend this hotel to family and friends!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent well located Hotel in central Madrid.”
Reviews.Author: desertdog3
Reviews.Content: An excellent and well located hotel in central Madrid. The room was clean and very comfortable. The staff were exceptionally friendly and helpful. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff; great location; small but efficient rooms”
Reviews.Author: AndyMell
Reviews.Content: This is a great little hotel located close to the Prado (major art museum). But, it's on a quiet side street, so the noise level is fine. It is also a short walk from Plaza Mejor, and a number of interesting residential neighborhoods. It's near to the railway station that serves Bracelona and Toledo. It's about a 25 minute drive from the airport, but you'll need to bring a map for taxi drivers, as ours had not heard of the hotel. Our room (queen) was small but efficient. There wasn't a lot of room to move around, but I guess spending time in the room isn't the reason you go to Madrid! The staff was always very helpful with directions and making dinner reservations for us. They were also always happy to get us a drink from the bar.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay...this is how a 4-star should be!”
Reviews.Author: JuliaVanderbilt
Reviews.Content: Was very happy with our 3-night stay at the Radisson Blu Madrid. The location is excellent if you want to see the big 3 museums, Prado, Thyssen and Reina Sofia. There's also the architectural marvel that is the Caixa Forum just 2 blocks away on the main street...and that was a wonderfully unexpected bonus. Restaurants, bars and cafes abound in the area...the streets are charming, small and cobbled. Plaza Mayor and Plaza del Sol are not too far away. It's in a great area especially since we were very interested in the museums. We were given a room on the third floor with a charming little balcony that overlooked the front of the hotel. Great natural light came in every morning and the room, while a tad small, was charmingly laid out, had great and restful colors, excellent bed furnishings and very good and dependable free WiFi. The bathroom was large and adequate with good toiletries and towels. I would have to say that the best part of our stay was the meticulous and warm care of a front desk person named Pablo. Not only did he recommend excellent restaurants around the area, he also managed to find us tickets for a great flamenco show. He was very warm, friendly and welcoming and it was his great hospitality that made all the difference!

Reviews.Title: “Centrally located boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: AroundGlobe
Reviews.Content: It's a small and very friendly hotel in the middle of everything. The hotel is very new and fresh. Though it bears only four stars plaque it's much more stylish and convenient than many of Madrid 5-stars hotels. We stayed in an upper floor suite and loved this spacious and stylish room. Breakfasts are well enough and the staff is very helpful. We will definitely stay in the same suite in this hotel if we are back in Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, great rooms, facilities and service and brilliant location”
Reviews.Author: andybarty
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights in January and found the hotel to be absolutely brilliant. We had rooms on the top floor and they were quiet and had great decor and facilities. The staff were really helpful, professional and friendly. The hotel's proximity to the museum triangle was a real highlight as was its proximity to very interesting and lively streets (for example Calle Huertas) full of bars, tavernas, restauranst and nightlife. If you are into theatre the marvellous Teatro Espanol in Plaza Santa Ana is only a stone's throw away. Thanks Radisson!!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely small hotel across from the Prado and near other museums”
Reviews.Author: mrwatson
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice business oriented hotel that is close by the major attractions of Madrid (quick walk to Puerta del sol, across from the Prado etc.). The rooms are small but comfortable. There is a small restaurant with a nice breakfast selection and a small set of options for other meals. It is located very close to some lovely tapas restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: worldtravelernow
Reviews.Content: I recently returned from the Radisson Blu Hotel and found it to be a wonderful hotel in a great location. The staff were all welcoming and friendly and my single room was a very nice size. The breakfast room was extremely pleasant and most mornings there was a nice variety of baked goods. There were delicious fruit and juices and you could have a fabulous omelette prepared especially for you. I used the indoor pool one evening and truly enjoyed myself and stayed for over one hour. It was a perfect size, and I had it entirely to myself which was very relaxing after a long day of touring. The hotel was very pretty from the outside and the lobby was very welcoming. It was very clean and modern and quite comfortable. The only thing that really bothered me was when I was checking out I was given my bill; and I noticed they had charged me for items from the minibar that I had not even touched. Every day someone knocked on the door and asked if I had used the minibar and each time I said I had not. I was miffed to say the least; and if I hadn't checked my bill carefully, I would have paid for someone else's refreshments. I would highly recommend that you carefully check your charges or you may be paying for things you did not use. Other than that incident, everything else was perfect; and I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Decent”
Reviews.Author: numb15
Reviews.Content: Pros: Friendly staff, great location, free wifi, brilliant bathroom with huge shower head and no annoying or mouldy bath like in the UK, decent breakfast. Cons: I had to change the key card twice as it deactivated for no apparent reason. The Fitness spa is poor quality (the tiny swimming pool had cold water, there was only one running machine and a bike, and the room was boiling hot). This was a complete contrast with the fitness areas in a Radisson, Sheraton and Hilton I stayed in when I was in Argentina and Uruguay, all three of which had huge swimming pools, big gyms on the top floor with lots of free weights and cardio machines and with fantastic views over the city. I think it must be a European thing to put a tiny fitness centre in the basement, I experienced this at other hotels in Europe and it's not pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and perfect location”
Reviews.Author: GoMarshy
Reviews.Content: Very impressed, an absolute bargain for less then £80 a night in a 4* hotel. Rooms very contemporary with modern bathrooms and walk-in shower room. Staff friendly and helpful. Perfecty located for the main art galleries but also in one of the livelier parts of town with losts of bars and places to eat between the hotel and Palca Mayor. The Mercado de San Miquel just outside the Placa Mayor is a must visit for food and drink in great surroundings

Reviews.Title: “Loved the hotel- the best costumer service ever!”
Reviews.Author: BCNRocks
Reviews.Content: Never have I stayed in a hotel that valued their costumers that much. The staff was very helpful, rushing to help with ANY request we had. We wanted to shorten our stay from 4 nights to 3, it was no problem to them. We just notified them of leaving on the same morning that we checked out. The room was smallish, but it didn't bother us at all. It was modern, cozy. Very comfortable bed:). My GOD, the breakfast! I have never had that great of a breakfast in a hotel, ever! It was not some usual hotel old sausage-yesterday's potatoes-breakfast. Here everything was genuine authentic traditional spanish kitchen. Real quality jamon iberico, fresh squeezed orange juice, many sorts of bread, sqeezed tomato to make your own pan con tomate, etc etc. Everything looked home made. Wifi is for free. I say the change that happened in Hotel chain's ownership had a very positive influence on the quality of these hotels!

Reviews.Title: “Hard to find fault”
Reviews.Author: LeighPhiladelphia
Reviews.Content: If you are a museum buff...this is the place to stay! Also location wonderful for tapas, dinner, late night activities. Staff very competant and helpful, all spoke english, even wait staff. I am an Architect and appreciated the very well designed interiors. Even minor problems promptly attended to by willing staff.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: alysonth
Reviews.Content: Extremely comfortable beds in smallish rooms, great sound-proofing so very quiet which is amazing in Madrid. No tub but huge shower in bathroom. Heated mirror so no misting which is a nice touch, also very good hairdryer. Plenty of closet space, excellent coffee maker and really delicious breakfasts with good pastries, fresh fruit salad, fresh orange juice and good coffee arrived within ten minutes of ordering from room service. Very friendly and competent young staff at reception. Did not try the restaurant - there are so many good tapas bars nearby. Hotel bar was empty when we were there. Wonderful location within minutes from Prado, Museo Thyssen-Bornemizsa, Atocha station, Botanical gardens and Retiro Park.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: agl120854
Reviews.Content: Can't agree with many of the other reviewers. Booked the hotel when to Room Mate Alicia was full for our last night in Madrid. Reasonable plan ahead rate (128 euros without breakfast) Upon entering the hotel there is a dark small entrance way with the reception desk. There was a dark unused whiskey bar straight ahead. the bar and restaurant were on a different level. Except for breakfast never saw a person in the restaurant. Check in was smooth but our "upgraded" business room was no different from any other room in the hotel. Small for the price but adequate. Did not use the spa. Definitely not a luxury experience. Location is OK but I enjoyed being near Santa Ana plaza more.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, Comfortable and Convenient”
Reviews.Author: charsmama
Reviews.Content: I was extremely pleased with the accommodations and service at the Radisson Blu Madrid Prado. We had originally booked at another hotel, but when they replied dismissively to an email I sent requesting information, I viewed that as a red flag. Fortunately, I had just read the New York Times review of the Radisson Blu, so I rebooked there and was not disappointed. The location is incredibly convenient, just ~100’ or so off the Paseo del Prado, placing it immediately across from the Prado Museum, yet located just behind another building so that traffic noise was limited. The hotel is on the corner of a small side street and a little square that houses a pleasant café/bar, with tables and plenty of seating. The reception staff at the Radisson Blu was a group of young, attractive women and men who were always welcoming, cheerful, and readily helpful. They greeted us pleasantly each time we passed through the lobby. Our room (212) was very comfortable and spotlessly clean. It overlooked a side street, so while we didn’t have a glamorous or expansive view, we could open the window to see the little square in front, yet we still enjoyed perfect quiet for sleeping. In fact, the hotel seemed to be exceptionally well sound-proofed, and that’s saying something, because I am a light sleeper. (Rooms on the front facing the square might not be as quiet.) The bed was firm but comfortable and offered a variety of pillow types, both light feather and firmer polyfill. The room offered plenty of lighting options: you could turn the lights up to very bright to see into a loaded black suitcase and yet also dim the bounce lights to more subdued lighting. The bedside reading lamps operated individually so that I could read the guidebook before sleep without keeping my husband up. Our bathroom didn’t have a tub, just a shower, but the rain shower had a handset with enough pressure to massage my feet. The hairdryer was so peppy that I used it instead of my own. The closet was roomy enough for us to hang clothes for 2 and offered a reasonable count of wooden hangers, including enough skirt hangers. A Nespresso machine was tucked in near the minibar and safe, and the coffee was free. The wireless worked flawlessly. There were some minor glitches. There is no standard lobby with seating where you can wait to meet someone. Instead, just inside the entry is a high concept and glassy-surfaced whiskey bar called “The Cask” which we never saw anyone occupy. The regular bar/restaurant has seating, but it is out of sight of the lobby. There are benches in the long doorway. The small “spa” in the basement was a little odd. I think there were 3 pieces of aerobic equipment and 1 TV, private rooms for massage, and a small dip pool that I had assumed was a hot tub but was instead a small plunge pool. Still, the environment was serene, and when my husband needed a nap I retreated to the spa, stretched out on one of the chaises and checked email and read while being soothed by the spa music. Also, the TV options were rather limited, i.e., no international CNN, just CNBC (I think.). Most channels were Spanish only, but – hey -- we weren’t there to watch TV. These issues were very minor. Overall, I really liked the hotel and I wish more offered these features for the price. I would definitely stay here again and would recommend it to friends without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “A gem in Madrid!!!”
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a short break and loved everything about this hotel. Ferran and his team were excellent!! I'm already planning a return visit!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location near train and museums”
Reviews.Author: BrooklynMiro
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a great place to stay upon arrival in Madrid after a long flight. Our room was ready early and the staff had many great recommendations. You can walk to the high speed train as well as Retiro Park, the Prado Museum, and Reina Sofia, and more. There is free wifi everywhere in hotel. You can walk to many great restaurants filled with local treats.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hospitality Experience Ever!!!”
Reviews.Author: guest218
Reviews.Content: Me and my partner stayed here for 3 nights on our very first visit to Spain, and believe me when I say Radisson truely redefines hospitality and customer service, we have stayed in several Radissons world wide and the 'wow' factor never stops. All the staff was excellent , a special thanks to Pablo the night receptionist for the amazing recommendations, and attention to detail to ensure our stay was a comfortable one. Location and breakfast was perfect, with clean and spacious rooms, and very close to attocha station (main railway station) and all major tourist attractions including prado museum/touristic bus stop. A must go night lcub is kapitol which is two minutes away from the hotel. We would certainly recommend this hotel to everyone and would definitely return to this one of a kind hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great business stay”
Reviews.Author: LiamRyan32
Reviews.Content: Stayed here while on business and it fulled all my requirements. The staff are friendly and the room I stayed in was very good with very good maid service. Location is pretty good, close to a great deal of museums and lovely small galleries. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Radisson blue Madrid, the Best”
Reviews.Author: zla123789
Reviews.Content: I rate this hotel with a 10/10 score. Why? super clean rooms, friendly and attentive staff, comfortable beds, excellent location, free and good wifi and WONDERFUL espresso free morning coffee in your room. The price was very decent for all the comfort we got. The locate is perfect because it is located in the centro and it is walking distance to sites of interest for tourists.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, small boutique hotel with big chain name”
Reviews.Author: Ouiparis
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Radisson Blu for two nights in July. I picked the hotel based on a great deal from expedia.com as well as the relative newness of the hotel. The location was perfect. We were a short walk away from El Retiro, the Prado (which we did not visit), and the Sofia Reina. The nearest Metro stop is Atocha, which is just 5-7 minutes away on foot. We appreciated the robes and slippers and comfy bed. I used the very small gym, which consisted of two stationary bikes and a treadmill. We would have loved to indulge in a few spa treatments but simply did not have the time. There are two cafes with outdoor seating directly in front of the hotel. They seemed to be very popular with the locals. The front desk staff could not be more cordial or helpful in suggesting places to eat. I would not hesitate to recommend and stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “to get every amenity, you pay a little more”
Reviews.Author: stevesenior
Reviews.Content: There are many hotels in a large city like Madrid. We first stayed in one for much less money, and the location was a far walk to the Prado and the amenities were few. There are also hotels far from everything a tourist is interested in. The Radisson Blue costs more, but is across the street from the Prado, and freely gives many amenities. They also video record a every transaction at the front desk, which could be useful because of the many pickpockets in the tourist section.

Reviews.Title: “The place to stay if you go to Madrid”
Reviews.Author: RasmusMunch
Reviews.Content: The perfect hotel in Madrid must be Radisson blu, Madrid Prado. From the second we arrived we felt welcome. The staff told us about the facilities and made themselves available should we need any help. Rooms were not big but adequate for this type of stay. Cleaning was perfect. Small but nice and relaxing spa-area. Staff friendliness and service was high. The service in the hotel restaurant, The Cask, was impeccable and Rodrigo made our dining experience excellent. The hotel is very nice located 50 meters from a main street, and it was quite calm and tranquille even though it was near many cozy bars and restaurants, 10 minutes from downtown Plaza del Sol, just a few minutes from the train and metro and 50 meters from the bus and taxis. We would recommend this hotel to everyone who wants to go to Madrid. Excellent price/value.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish boutique hotel - great location”
Reviews.Author: chris2401
Reviews.Content: My partner booked this hotel as a birthday present and we really enjoyed our stay! The room was ready for ckeck-in when we arrived, which was before the normal check-in time. The staff was very friendly and helpful making restaurant reservations as well as giving us tips on what to do. The room we had was on the smaller side, but has everything you need. The bathrooms were very cool. Breakfast was nice but too expensive compared to hotels in London. We also loved the spa area, the jacuzzi was fun too. I would recommend this hotel for sure -great for couples!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: eireboy
Reviews.Content: Throughly enjoyed our stay at this new Hotel, We arrived early from Ireland and were given our rooms straight away by the pleasant Receptionists. The Bedroom design was a breath of fresh air with lovely period doors to a small balcony out to the square , the bed was so comfortable it was a struggle to leave it! Breakfast was delicious, very well presented, Quality over Quantity. Great Location for walking around an Amazing City. A Small Hotel with no fuss & simplicity in all aspects. Recommend this and will return some day hopefully.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: PollyandPlup
Reviews.Content: Fabulous hotel. Excellent location, opposite Prado Museum and just off Calle de la Huertas for great restaurants and bars at night. We had a lovely spacious room with a balcony overlooking the Prado Museum. Traffic from the busy street could not be heard at all and the bed was one of the most comfortable I have ever slept in, The spa was great to relax in after a busy day sightseeing. Staff were all very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “relaxing break in madrid”
Reviews.Author: henb71
Reviews.Content: Just back from a great trip to madrid , the hotel was nice but the rooms are not very spacious ,there was no bath and after a long day of sight seeing and shopping its nice to relax in a bath. However there was a great big walk in power shower which was nice. The bar was very relaxing and the staff were friendly. There is a lovely thai restaurant called Phuket Thai which is about ten mins walk which was fab in Achocha and we went to restaurant Maria which was also fab in puerto del sol . i would recommend these highly. Starbucks is near the hotel also.
